text: @zei_squirrel you can tell who he's good faith to vs who he isn't. this is a commonplace thing in organizing too.. there'll be some guy who's effective at things that give mainstream legitimacy but then they're weirdly awful to trans leftists. our existence is their "the woke has gone Too Far"

@zei_squirrel glad you got your account back but this isn't a reason to think transphobic behavior is excusable, or that he's on the side of anyone in particular but himself/his own whims. he's creepily antagonistic towards nonbinary and trans people, misgenders his colleagues on purpose, etc

I say all this to emphasize that @ggreenwald is on our side. his critiques of the left are not intended to be destructive, but constructive. do not treat him as some toxic outcast who is beyond the pale, but engage w/ him honestly and critically (as I have!), and he'll listen

btw, a smear campaign which many in the US so-called "left" also gave credence to, happily throwing corbyn under the bus when the heat became a little too uncomfortable for them. because they're cowardly hacks who have no principles, no conception of solidarity

he supported bernie all throughout the campaign, even when many so-called "leftists" were hedging their bets with that snake warren. and, most importantly for me, he always stood firmly behind corbyn, and wrote about the vile smear campaign directed at him and the labour left

he has also always maintained a commitment to anti-imperialism, most recently doing very important work exposing those behind the bolivia coup and interviewing morales. he has reported on the censoring of palestinian voices through disgusting smear outlets like canary mission

as I've said before, @ggreenwald is the most important journalist in the world, who has done more than most to combat right-wing fascistic authoritarianism. the snowden reporting and his critical work that helped free lula who may very well defeat bolsonaro are but some examples

btw notice how @ggreenwald, one of the people I've been most critical of on here, helped me get my account back. there was no reason for him to do that. he could have easily ignored it and celebrated the demise of one of his critics. he didn't bc he has sincerely held principles
